page.title: 12BERECHURCH HALL ROAD
page.content: {BERECHURCH HALL _}was demolished after its military occupation during World War II. St.Michael's Church still stands in the wooded grounds. The Audley Chapel inside has a beautiful hammer_beam roof and contains the tomb of Thomas,Lord Audley. The woodland surrounding the church is now being developed for building. Flats are being built at an estimated cost of Â£65,000. {THE MILITARY CORRECTIVE TRAINING {CENTRE_}is a detention centre serving all three armed services. It was established in 1945 and only houses military prisoners. The prisoners work in the market garden and sell the produce. Also pigs are reared. {MAYPOLE GREEN _}there is a public house on the green called The Maypole. The pub was originally a 18th century Essex farmhouse,converted in 1954.
